thread.title: Hang with Manu Delago in the Austrian Alps
thread.title_full: Hang with Manu Delago in the Austrian Alps

title: Hang with Manu Delago in the Austrian Alps
text:
Hang with Manu Delago in the Austrian Alps The Cinematic Orchestra, Björk and Anoushka Shankar-approved musician premieres his Freeze video. © Maria Kirchner By Glen Ferris on 28 February 2017 
From a basement in Innsbruck to the top of the Austrian Alps, Manu Delago has climbed the heights – figuratively and literally. 
Ten years since his first YouTube video , filmed in his hometown lower-ground apartment, the renowned hang musician has moved to London and worked with everyone from Björk to The Cinematic Orchestra – he even co-wrote Anoushka Shankar's Grammy-nominated Land Of Gold album. 
Now with new album Metromonk (his third solo album on Tru Thoughts ), the boundary-testing artist is exploring the hang in new and highly inventive ways. 
“I wanted to create fresh, electronic soundscapes that are generated through live performance and therefore feel organic and human”, says Delago. “It may initially sound like programming or production, but it's all happening there in the moment.” 
So, with that ethos in mind, the artist headed off to the Tyrolian Alps, where he spends most of his downtime in summer, to shoot a one-take video for the track Freeze. 
Filmed by 14 cameras, but without a cameraman, and using seven mirrors to create the illusion of a 360-degree view of the scenery, the stunning setting is a fine match for the live performance. 
Watch the video for Freeze exclusively in the player above. 
Manu Delago is currently touring worldwide with his new album Metromonk. All dates can be found on manudelago.com . Manu Delago premieres the video for Freeze © Maria Kirchner Related Stories
